text: you know whats a load of crap. There's a vim extension for VSCode, an Emacs extension but no dang nab Nano extension. No one respects the greatest things

text: I mean, what would you expect a nano extension to do? :stuck_out_tongue:

text: its as if you are unaware of the hotkeys available to the end user via Nano Mose.

text: <https://www.nano-editor.org/dist/latest/cheatsheet.html> look at those marvelous options. Did you know you can get syntax highlighting in Nano?

text: I've never used Nano for anything non-trivial but I was actually really surprised to learn recently how many features it has

elements.text: I've never used Nano for anything non-trivial but I was actually really surprised to learn recently how many features it has

text: So at my first job out of school me and some coworkers had a running gag. Someone claimed VIM, and the other guy was using emacs or something so I had to pick Nano. And yea it is really surprising but to be honest it was horrible for writing code okay for git commits lol

text: Despite my constant evangelization of :emacs: , I still have `EDITOR=nano` :upside_down_face:
